column4: I'm getting ready to download the newest version of ubuntu because I can't find my iso anymore, any reason the 32-bit version is listed as "recommended"?
Can't remember if I saw that there before or not, haha
So if I just planning on using it on my 64-bit boxes then theres no reason I shouldnt get x64? Or is it one of those situations where the 32-bit version is probably more hassle-free in the long run?
32-bit is recommended because you can use 32-bit on 64-bit systems but not the other way around. x64 is no more of a hassle.
